greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total sum A(n,k) of k-th powers of parts in all partitions of n; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: In general, if k > 0 then column k is asymptotic to 2^((k-3)/2) * 3^(k/2) * k! * Zeta(k+1) / Pi^(k+1) * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) * n^((k-1)/2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 27 2018
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, p, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0], `if`(p<1, [0, 0],
mathematica: b[n_, p_, k_] := b[n, p, k] = If[n == 0, {1, 0}, If[p < 1, {0, 0}, Sum[Function[l, If[m == 0, l, l + {0, First[l]*p^k*m}]][b[n - p*m, p - 1, k]], { m, 0, n/p}]]] ; a[n_, k_] := b[n, n, k][[2]]; Table[Table[a[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 12 2013, translated from Maple *)

(* T = A066633 *) T[n_, n_] = 1; T[n_, k_] /; k<n := T[n, k] = T[n-k, k] + PartitionsP[n-k]; T[_, _] = 0; A[n_, k_] := Sum[T[n, j]*j^k, {j, 1, n}]; Table[A[n-k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 15 2016 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 28 2013
